Eine sehr psychodelische Erfahrung, schwer zu beschreiben. 
Man kann Partikel in einem Raum manipulieren mit verschiedenen Werkzeugen. Aber vielleicht bin ich nur zu blöd, es richtig zu kapieren.

Man fühlt sich wie Gott zu Zeiten des Urknalles, und bringt die wild durch den Raum fliegenden Partikel in ein Ordnungssystem oder stiftet Chaos, baut Sonnenuntergänge, Galaxien oder was Einem noch so einfällt, oder legt sich bei einer der Demo-Spielstände auf den Boden und genießt die psychedelische und bunte Aussicht.

Hat mir zwar sehr Spaß gemacht, aber man kann nicht wirklich viel "machen"

Trotzdem Damen hoch

36435041.review:
Sometimes I'm in a bad mood when I get home from work, and nothing sounds fun, and I don't want to talk to anyone, so I put on some music and play Chroma Lab, and it gets me right out of my funk.

It's very entertaining to experiment with all the different tools, as well as the various options that control the physics and graphics. It's occasionally breathtaking, especially with the right music. I thought it'd be one of those throwaway apps that are only good for a demo, but I'm happy to say that this will stay on my hard drive for a long time!

36411100.review: Very trippy game. Chroma lab and Soundscape are my two favorite VR games when I'm in an altered state and want to really blow my mind. 36296398.review: If you are new to VR or want something to show off how amazing VR is i think this is the absolute best app for it. It's super simple yet has pretty complex options that really change the look and feel of the experience. And it's so cheap! This is always the first thing i show someone new to VR. Pick it up, you definitely won't regret it.

36262514.review:
Nice particle effects based visualiser that reacts in time to music being played on your PC, and is an easy recommendation at the price.

While it is great, I feel there is a lot of room for fine tuning and enhancement. The UI is rather clumsy with duplicated functions wasting buttons - am on a Rift, the grip buttons are doubled up with the joystick click for selecting functions, would be nice to use grip for pull effects.

Some more graphical effects and colour schemes would be nice, but this is a great start.

36244406.review:
Drugs are not optional.

Amazing particle sandbox, definitely worth the price, whack your favourite tunes on and mess around, you won't realise how long you've been in there

36230460.review:
Fling particles around in a box for $5?  Count me in!

This is a great amount of fun, and good to demo VR for new people.

Lots of choices for controlling the physics and rendering engine.  There is a lot of content in the options menu.

The bigger video card the better but rins super smooth on my Laptop's 1060.

36136600.review:
It's very fun to play with. If you've ever enjoyed any kind of visualizer for your music, this is great fun to just kinda zone out and mess around with. Lots of controls for the physics, such as different types of partricles, gravity slider, time speed slider, color types (Manually paint the particles, rainbow particles, particles that change color based on speed, and ones that change based on friction/impacts), audio reactivity settings, a lava lamp mode (Gravity on roof and ground). 

Then theres the tools. There's the gravity/pushy away tool, which pulls or pushes particles based on your slider settings. Then there's the "gun" which shoots a blob of particles, or a steady stream, with a slider that changes velocity. Then an explosion tool that causes an explosion at your cursor. A paintbrush. And the "ball" tool that lets you create positive or negative magnets, and portal "balls" that transport particles from one ball to another.

36051084.review:
My new favourite vr game! Like if nvidia's flex demo and cosmic sugar had a baby on LSD! 

Edit: I say that the controls are advance, they really are not. Its just the menus are confusing to work around and navagating between things is tricky for a first time player. Stil love this game nearly 3 hours in! 

100% reccommend //although it is not very good for demoing as the controls are a bit advanced, but a simple mode would fix this!

This is one of my required games for a new vr player!

35962335.review:
Colorful. Amazing. 

One of my favourite things to do is lie and and enable the lava lamp feature. Drift away to sleep with colorful orbs and blobs rising and dropping through your skull.... relaxing.

A visual trip for the eyes. The colors amaze, the physics are hypnotizing.

35480349.review: Awesome, best particle simulation i tried so far for VR.

35429045.review:
Very very nice sandbox! 
This particle simulation is amazing!
It's a huge fun to play with them and testing out whats possible to do with them.

For 5€ it's absolutly okay, but at some point you tried everything and you're hungry for more...

So I have some improvement recommendations for the next version or update which I really wish for:

- No borders/walls: Make a closed but repeating "universe". (maybe with a kind of fog around the user)
- Do you know the opensource sandbox "The Powder Toy" ? Please make different particles interacting with each other
- Pls make it possible to import 3d-models (.obj for example) to interact and play with the particles
- It would be great to add or delete particles (I think the numbers of the current version is simply constant)
- Different aggregate states (solid, fluid, gas) / maybe with temperature?
- More simple tools like the sphere tool but with different shapes and functions

As you can see, your game has a huge potential! I would pay at least 4 times more if you bring up these features in the next/update version!

35295515.review: This is now my go-to music visualizer. Spend some time in there getting to know the settings and you'll be repayed in hours of enjoyment. Listen to your own music with your own passive visuals or get interactive and splash that crap everywhere.

35216209.review: This was an amazing experience. Just put on your favorit music and go with the flow. I actually cried 10/10

35015345.review:
This is a visual treat. I've never done drugs, but if you happen to be someone that does, then this game is for you. 

It's a physics bassed particle simulation and with all the different settings you're given, mixed with the varied tools you can use, you basically create some of the coolest visuals available in VR. There were times I just laid down in my room and looked up at the ceiling to watch the show when I lowered gravity and had lavalamp mode on. Such a treat.

34993584.review: This is the best particle app so far for VR.  10/10

34873241.review:
This is an absolutely amazing VR experience. Turn on any inspiring music on your PC and lose yourself in a tactile swirl of undulating particles that you twist and flip and explode like a wizard in a ball pit. Everyone who has tried this has been absolutely captivated and enchanted by it. From animators to professional drummers to IT guys, it makes everyone discover a real joy of playing again. 

I bought a 1080ti to future proof my PC for VR, and yet i havent experienced a game that takes advantage of it in a real way till this. 1.5X SS and 1 MILLION BALLS to play with! It is a stunning thing to see and control. 

Buy this game. For the love of all that VR could grow to be, buy this game. It is so decently priced, and once you start playing with the different particle types, gravity, colour reaction settings, and scale of the world, its got hours and hours of replayability. Make sure you play music. Make sure you show it to people you think look stressed and need an unexpected joyful shock of crazy play and grin inducing colour therapy. Make sure you tell everyone you know to try it and everyone you know with VR to buy it. 

If you hate it, refund before the 2 hrs. (I'm willing to bet for most people those 2 hrs will feel more like a mad 30 minutes at most however!)

Im not associated with the designer in anyway, but this is such a great example of why VR is going to be big. Dont watch the videos and think 'MEH' The difference in the game is immense. You are physically in the world with a real solid swirling mass that bends to your will, you control it. And every choice you make in how to control it results in joyous visual feedback. This game deserves to be backed, if only to allow the designer to develo it even further.

What are you waiting for? Buy it, find a playlist of your best soaring tunes, and then lose yourself. You might just like it, because me? I loved it.

34872519.review:
It's $5 and is a unique experience. I pay $5 at a bar to try an IPA that ends up tasting similar to every other IPA I've had. I doubt I'll put a ton of hours into Chroma Lab, but it's unlike anything I've ever experienced before. 

Tip: Make sure to check out the preset options with the menu button.

34867030.review:
[h1]That was way more fun than I thought[/h1]

[b]Who knew playing with particles would instill such joy[/b]

I bought the game on a whim, in fact, I figured my daughters might like it, so what the hell.
After 52 minutes in a single session, I realized I was having an absolute blast. I enjoyed smashing particles together, whirling them around, attracting and then repelling them, particles are quite fun!

[b]Lots of settings that make a difference[/b]

Aside from the few tools the game gives you, you can adjust settings which change the shape and nature of the particle, as well as change the physics of how they behave. You can add gravity, make their colour change based on speed or thermals or even collision. 

I saw some sound options in there as well, to make the particles react to different sounds, although I didn't get a chance to mess with that as my headphones weren't plugged in. 

Either way, I didn't really miss the sound as I was busy feasting on the delicious visuals. 

If you own a Vive or an Oculus (not sure if this works on Oculus), this is a great title, and pretty fairly priced.

There are certainly worse ways to spend a few bucks, as well as an afternoon. 

[b]Pro Tip:[/b] Look at the world through the white pointers that float just beyond your Vive controllers. See a world within a world.

As someone who never writes reviews I had to come and say that this was more than worth the money paid. The developer could have gotten away with a lot less features but instead it is crammed with options to tweak the possibilities. 34579021.review:
物理演算で相互干渉する無数の粒子が飛び交う空間で遊ぶゲームで、基本はPV見たまんまです。
接待用に5分もプレイして、わーきれーいってできればいいかなーと思って買ったのですが、なかなかどうして、結構遊べます。

粒子を集めたり散らしたりワープさせたりといったツールのほかに、オプションで粒子の粘度、スピード、重力の強さ等々をいじることができ、これらを使ってできる表現の幅が広く、ちょっとしたオブジェや空間が作れます。思い通りの粒子の流れを作るのは夢中になりますし、作ってる途中で思わぬ相互干渉から面白い表現ができたりします。適当にやってもそれなりに美しいので、楽しいです（笑）。作ったものは保存しておけます。

BGMは無いので自前で流しましょう。デスクトップに流れるBGMに合わせて粒子がきらめいてくれます。テクノなんか聞いて粒子を吹っ飛ばしたりしてるとちょっとしたトリップ感あります。

常にライブラリのお気に入りに入れておきたい一本になりました。
VRって素晴らしい。

34577036.review:
Hallo,
Es fühlt sich toll an.
Sehr viele Einstellungen sind möglich.
Zeitlupe erlaubt es z.B. einen Einschlag langsam zu verfolgen.
Mit den Farbpaletten kann man sehen wie die kinetische Energie
durch den Körper dringt. So meine ich es jedenfalls zu beobachten :)
Es ist als würde man mit einen Hammer in eine Sandburg schlagen.
Wer gern experimentiert sollte auf jedenfall zugreifen.
Die Meinungen gehen auseinander.
Der Eine ist völlig begeistert und der Andere kann nichts damit anfangen.

34568628.review:
Do you want to pull apart a fiercely glowing black hole, or smash scintillating atoms together, or control the waves like a waterbender, or play in a giant ball pit that's *also* a lava lamp?

Wait, that's a rhetorical question. The answer is yes. You do. You should try Chroma Lab.

At under $5, it's a no-brainer. I figured it would just be a fun little VR demo -- and in fairness, it is -- but the couple of minutes that I meant to spend in there turned into a couple of hours as I explored the variety of physics and graphical parameters, each of which can change the character of a scene in fascinating ways.

You can tell the developer paid a lot of attention to the details here: it's well-optimized; the grab tool's sphere on one hand interacts with the other's in a metaball-like way; there are trippy stereo shaders all over the menus (including one sort of hidden in the targeting cursor).

I don't have many criticisms to offer. The UI has a bit of a learning curve, and like others I think it'd be nice to be able to share saves. Additional particle shaders, coloring modes, and manipulation tools would be icing on the cake.

34560890.review: One of my favorite VR experiences for the HTC Vive. Has everything a great VR experience should have: fun physics, attractive visuals and colors, infinite possibilities and is even made better by your own music. This game continues to blow my mind each time I jump in. The game has come a long way from the early stages of development and can see many new features coming in the future. Would definitely give it a shot even if it's not your first time trying VR.

34560842.review: This is a must-get for your boilerplate VR library. I lost myself in it for a couple hours the first time I booted it up. Throw on some good tunes, and you'll find yourself getting lost in the most bizarre descriptions of what you're doing. Sometimes it's like pouring frozen yogurt into a cone. No, wait, now it's like throwing a bucket of water against a wall. Actually, it's like spinning your finger around in a glass and creating a whirlpool. This is what happens when you're dealing with a pure particle simulation and a suitably robust toolkit to manipulate it: It's crawling with implied emergent possibilities, it's endlessly rewarding of your experimentation, and it's easy to get very lost in it. Excellent.

34556821.review:
I've only got one hour of this game in, but it's probably some of my favorite VR time I've ever had.  This particle playground is exactly what I imagine when I think of the myriad applications of virtual reality.  A simple interface, easy controls (once you get used to them, it did take me a little bit to get the hang of it) and a lot of options from scale and gravity physics settings to color palletes, and even reacts to audio so you can listen to music while you feel like a diety creating and smashing worlds together.  

The dev is very responsive on both Reddit and the Steam Discussions, which is always a plus in my book.

34556566.review: Simply amazing. My favourite so far is Preset 2: Try to get the little balls to slowly float as close to you as possible, but not so close that the ball loses its spherical shape. Wow.

34518287.review:
Oh wow. I just spent 90 minutes in this app without realizing it. This is the most mesmirizing VR experience I have encountered (and I have a huge library), and now I'm hard-pressed to describe it. It's like being inside a lava lamp blowing bubbles and chasing morphing clouds of playdough that pulse in time to the music and orbits around planets.

Do put on music, and make sure the sound-reactive option is turned on. This is essential.

34517559.review:
Amazing particle simulation toy. I found myself giggling like a little kid. Visually this is one of the most amazing things I've experienced in VR. It's like you're watching galaxies condense, but then you get to play god and control their flow. Technically its also extremely impressive that I can have smooth framerate with so many particles, and even with the occasional moment where there is too much physics going on, rather than dropping headset framerate, the physics simulation just gets slowed down.

This is a must buy.

34515964.review: Its worth it! Very funny to play around with. Took me a while to figure out what you can do there. Very nice that you have save slots to save your work.

34515476.review: Ein wunderschönes Erlebnis in VR! Die Beschreibung "physikalischer Partikel-Simulator" ist zwar treffend, beschreibt aber nicht den Spaß, den man mit diesem Programm haben kann, auch ohne irgendeine Ahnung von Physik oder Partikeln zu haben! Das Programm hat viele Einstellmöglichkeiten, aber auch für den schnellen Start mehrere Beispiele mitgeliefert. Granz toll finde ich die Lava-Lampen-Beispiele, insbesondere das mit den großen Bällchen. Mit einem Klick im Menü schaltet man den Lava-Lampen-Effekt ab und man steht in einem waschechtes Bällchenbad und kann dort nach Herzenslust z.B. mit einer Art Luftdüse oder Staubsauger die Bällchen bewegen und verwirbeln. Wenn man sich dazu noch seine Lieblingsmusik an macht (das Programm kann sogar darauf reagieren), dann kann man sich in diesem VR-Erlebnis sehr gut verlieren und vom RL abschalten!

34470738.review: Very immersive, runs amazing on my 1060 6GB. Worth the 5$ if you're interested by it. Decent selections of ways to interact (placeable gravity wells, hands as gravity wells, shoot from hand, etc.) A great soothing experience. I haven't tried it with music yet.

34470047.review:
VERY IMPRESSIVE!! This is the most intense and amazing VR experience to date.  For any of you seeking an interactive VR music visualizer... THIS. IS. IT!

All you need to do is queue up some music on your computer then open Chroma Lab and GO NUTS!

Steam Music works. Spotify works. A web browser works. Literally any audio source will work. Just play music somehow on your computer!

If you want a little extra mind**** , follow these instructions to open a feedback loop from the Vive Microphone:

OPEN Control Panel  >>  HARDWARE and SOUND  >>  SOUND  >>  CLICK the RECORDING Tab  >>  OPEN the PROPERTIES of the USB MIC (Vive Mic)  >>  CLICK the RECORDING Tab  >>  CHECK "Listen To This Device"

Now while in Chroma Lab, you'll be able to hear your own voice with a slight delay. It effects the visuals and really adds to the experience!!

If I were to be critical at all, the interface has a learning curve and could use some work and explaination. BUT I SEE THIS GOING PLACES! KUDOS!!

34469067.review:
Was impressed then I hit the X3 scale option and yaw hit the floor ! 

Just buy this

34466780.review:
I got this for free as I was an early tester, I'm not sure how much I should say, but uh... this went from "meh" to "I want to live in here!" pretty quickly. Today I was just going to try the release version out for a little while, and spent an hour exploring the available features.

Key pointers to enjoy this:
[list]
[*] Make sure to put on music as there is like zero audio, but the particles can react to music, so that is fine, as long as you put on said music!
[*] Toggle the audio reactive mode, the audio wave mode, put on the bloom effect for extra visual oompfh.
[*] Don't forget to check out the presets, load them to see what is possible, especially if feel tired and uncreative. 
[*] And, in that same menu, make sure to notice the different pages at the top, to change all kinds of settings, that is where the title gets greatly expanded.
[*] Definitely check out lava-lamp mode, a favorite of mine. I ended up flat on the floor looking at my ceiling and felt like I had inverted gravity.
[/list]

I've bought VR games way more expensive than this experience that I've spent less time in, definitely recommended, just don't forget the music!

34466265.review: Great little VR toy, hours of fun! :)

34465237.review: holy fuck i am glad i gave this a chance. looked like just another quick gimmick release. started listening to some music dicking with settings 'hey this is pretty fucking cool'. after an hour 'i wish i could adjust color settings though'. realize i hadnt even opened the actual menu, was just playing with control effects, mind gets blown. another hour of playing around later 'i'll just check out presets real quick, how cool could they be'. almost another hour later i need to change my pants. unbelievable content for the money and absolutely worth it even if you only 'kinda like music'. a must fucking have if you like anything with bass.

34457408.review: Best VR experience to demo, just have fun and for kids since sliced bread !

34456947.review: Absolutely mesmerising. Could do with even more settings, presets and tools!  Up there with Google Earth, Tilt Brush and Million Rainbow Stars as my fave experiences.

34452950.review: I never write reviews but this game got me to.  $5 is less than a dinner, and it's got some crazy replayability. There are the exact kind of adjustments like particle type, how fluid it is, gravity, great physics.  I have a gtx 1080 and an i76700K and i never get any lag unless i max the particle count.  If you run 1/2 to 3/4 the particle limit, it runs flawlessly.  Very much recommend.

34452405.review:
Amazing!

Control particles with various tools and make your own experience.  The game has no music, but that's fine, because you can play your own in the background and watch the beautiful pixels dance to your tunes.  Plenty of customization options to keep you busy on top of the default (and still amazing) settings.

This is a great way to chill, and is also a great experience to show your friends.  Highly recommended, especially for the low asking price of 5 bucks.

34451831.review: fun to play alongside listening to youtube or music.

34449446.review: Got a tester key months before the release. The game puts you inside a box flowing in space with a brick of pixels you can splash about to your favorite jams. I highly recommend it.

34448922.review: Really unique experience. Goes right up there with Tilt Brush on the list of must-haves. Oh, and try the lava lamp mode.

34445809.review: One of the best Vive experiences I’ve had. This is amazing to play with music as it reacts with the particles. The in game settings are very good as it allows a lot of different customization. I'm definitely looking forward to future updates.

34445661.review: Great! Very affordable, awesome trippy reactive visuals- perfect!

34445592.review:
I was sceptic that I would like this, not being a big fan of sandbox games, but I thought I'd give it a try. It costs less than a decent lunch, after all. After firing this up and starting some nice music in my headphones I had suddenly spent over an hour playing around, choreographing the thousands of particles to the music. The control system was a bit confusing at first, but self-explaining by trial and error in a few minues, especially after looking at the default presets.

All in all, I'm pleasantly surprised. It is a nice, relaxing game that's great to play after a long day at work. I can definitely see it as a great first game for a first-timer in VR. :)

34444990.review: Absolutely mesmerizing! One of the best experiences on VR yet.

34444268.review:
Listen to your favorite music and watch trippy particles move and glow to the music. 

Watching thousands of particles clump, bounce and move around you in 3D is surprisingly mesmerizing.
Works with any audio, so you can play your favorite playlists on spotify or youtube and they will work in game.

Plenty of tools to influence the environment, physics and particle variables keep the game fresh throughout many songs.

If you like trippy visual stuff this is a must buy! Definitely worth it for a mere €5.

34427665.review: Anyone who loves toying with visualisers, physics and marvelling at colours must take a look at Chroma Lab. For its ridiculously low pricepoint you'll have an amazing time. It could be described as a virtual lava lamp but frankly that's underselling it - it's a marvelous way to relax and have fun causing colourful chaos to your favourite music.

34427251.review:
*Clunk*

Did you hear that?

That was the sound of my jaw hitting the floor.

34426898.review:
Breathtaking, real-time particle physics simulation. This is a program that places you in the same space as hundreds of thousands of particles where each particle is given a set of physics rules to follow. This is all calculated very fluidly in the many cores of your gpu itself such that the many particles being simulated become an entity or entities that feel organic and alive. One moment pulsating swarms of bees, or galaxies of stars spiraling into a black hole or cascading fountains of fluids.

Of course, this would be fantastic if it were simply on a 2D screen. But given this is VR, it becomes a truly spectacular and immersive experience within which you command and control swarms of colourful and pulsating particles using attractive and repulsive gravity. Add music and your particles will dance to the beat, becoming a spectacular interactive light show.

This is mindblowing stuff and highly recommended!!

34426821.review: Chroma Lab is a heck of a lot more enjoyable than I imagined it would be.  I've always enjoyed tech demos, physics in games, etc so this really scratches that itch of being able to mess about with physics and change settings.  Chroma Lab is a steal at the price it's being sold for so if watching the video and reading the description for it interests you in any way, jump on it and buy this!  I played around with it while listening to music and it was so relaxing.  I like that it comes with various presets of environments for you to play with too.  Overall, it feels very intuitive and simple to get the hang of and I really can't wait to see future updates to this!  I know this isn't much of a review but I really just wanted to get the word out there that Chroma Lab is a ton of fun and well worth the price.

34426730.review: ok yes its not a new concept . se cosmic sugar . but hell the exicution is PERFECT !

34423244.review:
This is the absolute best physics simulator that I have seen. Just wow!!!!!!!! I cant imagine finding one to beat this for a long time. The dev actually added some stuff by my suggestion such as wave based audio reactivity.

34422982.review:
After two hours playing with Croma Lab (I’ve bought two hours ago) I can say only one thing: this is the best experience I’ve played (and I’ve tested a lot!). You can spend hours and hours in it if you like particles & physics, or your’re an artist or you want a trip without risks (I think I don’t need drugs, food or sex anymore ! ). 
Only could be better if you could share your presets with others (browse online) , or change particles with custom models; perhaps make the UI has a haptic response, multiuser sharing same space (impossible I suppose because the big data you generate) ; some lights you can put in space (visible on the sphere particles)….
And the price is a bargain, I would paid 10 ,15 or 20€ after testing it; please, make some DLC’s we can pay the author for his great job!

34421838.review:
Truly an awesome experience. Once you get inside, the wealth and the depth of options and possibilities presented to you are remarkable. I can only believe that it will get better going forward from this point, as shown by the developer's desire to know how he could possibly improve the experience. 

In my opinion, Chroma Lab is worth at least three times what it is currently selling for, and to get such a full and rich experience for under $5 is a rarity. Buy this immediately would be my recommendation. You won't regret it, there's hours of fun for the creative type interested in exploring the possibilities offered within Chroma Lab.

34421210.review: I freaking love ChromaLab. I've spent 5 hours in it in my short time in the beta and I'm looking forward to more.
